page.title: 17POPULATION.
page.content: { ALL CLASSES AND AGES IN OWSTON There are 23 houses in or just outside Owston containing families from all walks of life and within the age range{3_70.}There are fifteen children under 12, seven older children and eight senior citizens. Four families have young people who have left the village for further education or work but who return from time to time. In recent years the population has remained steady with young children being born into the village replacing teenagers leaving home. Only one pensioner does not have his own home. He is looked after by another family. There are no one_parent families or any very aged or infirm people. A census is made annually for the electoral roll. Births usually take place in hospital.
